I know someone made a post about crowley being mr. mistoffelees and all I can say is...
aziraphale loves mr. mistoffelees...crowley does resemble him a tiny bit...aziraphale has noticed...he doesn't hate it
summary: All right @mirawonderfulstar here we go, try and TELL me again that Aziraphale doesn’t like Cats!?? TELL me Aziraphale didn’t...
body:
All right @mirawonderfulstar here we go, try and TELL me again that Aziraphale doesn’t like Cats!??

TELL me Aziraphale didn’t lose his MIND when he was sitting in that theater in 1981 and he first saw Mr. Mistoffelees’ song.

Cats, the Musical: “When you notice a cat in profound meditation
The reason, I tell you, is always the same
His mind is engaged in a rapt contemplation
Of the thought, of the thought, of the thought of his name
His ineffable, effable, effanineffable
Deep and inscrutable singular name”

Aziraphale, a being whose true existence is a sound no human can hear: :O

I see your ‘Aziraphale doesn’t like Cats’ and I raise you, Aziraphale started using the word ‘Ineffable’ after he heard it in Cats


Aziraphale, singing quietly to himself in a jolly jazz tune: Have you been an alumnus of Heaven or Hell?

Crowley: ???


Tell me Aziraphale, 6000 years old, doesn’t bawl his eyes out to ‘Memory’


Aziraphale: I bet you wish you were the Rum Tum Tugger, don’t you?

Crowley: >:(

Crowley: Well, you’re the Gumbie Cat

Aziraphale: >:O


Crowley: Bet you wish you were Mr. Mistoffelees, don’t you?

Aziraphale: *wistfully* Yes….

And from then on, whenever Aziraphale has a magic show, Crowley introduces him with the opening to the Mr. Mistoffelees poem.

blog.name: irisbleufic
blog.title: (lives between pages)
blog.description: Holistic Writer / INTJ / Chaotic Good / Slytherin / Jewish / QIA-spec in LGBTQIA+ / autistic rabblerouser / still in my 30s / they-pronouns. Emma Goldman stan. Survivor of traumas I only discuss when relevant. Contains black tea, insomnia, poetry, & fic—but mostly just fic. If you're looking for CoT 'Verse and the rest of my Good Omens fic, you can find it here. As of 2013, all of my old LJ-era fanfiction has been uploaded to AO3. I'm the nutter behind @ask-agnes-nutter, so feel free to send asks. I moderate for the largest, most active GO Discord server, The Ritz; if you would like an invite, please DM me. You can pester me; I strongly encourage anons, because I know not everyone finds sending asks easy. If you want to know where to find my published work, email me on irisbleufic@gmail.com or send a DM. If you make art based on my writing, podfic my stories, or do anything you want me to see, tag it #irisbleufic. I won’t tell folks they shouldn't follow, but there's complex content here. I tag thoroughly. You can ko-fi me if you wish.

summary: I remember you had a post that gave a count of how many paperback Good Omens copies you've lost because the folks you lent to...
question: I remember you had a post that gave a count of how many paperback Good Omens copies you've lost because the folks you lent to never returned. How many people do you think you've gotten to read the book since you got into the fandom in '04?
answer:
To be fair, anon, in 3 out of 4 of the paperback loaning cases, I was almost 100% certain I wouldn’t be getting them back anyway.  You just have to account for the possibility when you loan someone Good Omens.  They will want to keep it, or they will lose it or destroy it in some way and be afraid to tell you.

As for how many people have read the book on account of my recommendation in the past going-on-15 years?  Oh, good lord.  Probably 20 or 30 people I could name precisely if you gave me some time to sit and type a list, and probably hundreds more that I’ll never be able to track because they either a) lurk on my blog, b) spotted my fic on AO3 and needed to read the novel first, or c) both.

summary: Good Omens - בנדיקט קמברבאץ' יגלם את השטן
title: Good Omens - בנדיקט קמברבאץ' יגלם את השטן
body:
Good Omens – בנדיקט קמברבאץ’ יגלם את השטן

עוד פרט נהדר לגבי סדרת הקומדיה הבריטית החדשה Good Omens ביחד עם תאריך בכורה רשמי

אחרי שראינו את הטריילר הראשון של Good Omens והתלהבנו מסדרת האדפטציה המסקרנת של דייוויד טננט ומייקל שין, אנחנו מקבלים הכרזה חדשה לגבי כוכב בריטי ענק נוסף שיצטרף לסדרה בתפקיד אייקוני.

למרות שאמר שפרויקט הסרטים שלו עמוס מדי בשביל להמשיך את הסדרה האהובה “שרלוק הולמס”, אנחנו נקבל בתפקיד קטן (פרק אחד מתוך שישה) על המסך…

View On WordPress

blog.name: electrickitten
blog.title: Kitten
blog.description: Posts I've liked My Hibernating Project for the Ravellenic Games 2014

summary: I finished Shirley Jackson's  The Haunting of Hill House. This should be added to high school American literature courses. I...
body:
I finished Shirley Jackson’s The Haunting of Hill House. This should be added to high school American literature courses. I really enjoyed the subtle character development and the overall story. I’m not sure that I can bring myself to watch the TV series after this though I might go look for the first movie adaption.

I am currently listening to Good Omens. It feels like an ode to the 80s that only Britons can truely understand. I’m only halfway through and feel like I don’t know enough about New Age philosophy to get only half the references. I am nostalgic for Them since I am roughly the same age and did similar things, though usually on my own. I am looking forward to this tv series if only to see how the update it.

blog.name: they-handed-me-the-moon
blog.title: They Handed Me The Moon
blog.description: Paige, 23, she/her, queer. This blog is for whatever catches my interest, which for now is primarily Good Omens

summary: I just want to say: I’m delighted many Good Omens fans seem to headcanon Anathema as a lesbian. There’s plenty of room for...
body:
I just want to say: I’m delighted many Good Omens fans seem to headcanon Anathema as a lesbian.

There’s plenty of room for multiple interpretations here, and I’m certainly not bothered when people don’t read her that way. But there’s something about this story of a young girl who grows up with an apparently set-in-stone prophecy about how she will spend her final day with a man and have sex with him and that will be the climax and conclusion of her life blah blah blah, but that day arrives and she frankly just finds the whole thing kinda disappointing and unfulfilling and then its over and … life goes on. And when Newt stalls her from opening the new book of Agnes Nutter’s prophecies, something clicks. She begins to hope for the very possibility that has been terrifying her since the world didn’t end. Perhaps … perhaps she needn’t be a descendent with a pre-written story any longer. Perhaps, after all, she isn’t doomed to choose the life previous generations chose for her.

I highly doubt Anathema’s story is intended to reflect the queer experience. But to me, it rings true to the experience of so many queer women raised with traditional heteronormative expectations writ large to the point that we are long unable to imagine an alternative to the only story we are given.

reblog.comment:
I just want to say: I’m delighted many Good Omens fans seem to headcanon Anathema as a lesbian.

There’s plenty of room for multiple interpretations here, and I’m certainly not bothered when people don’t read her that way. But there’s something about this story of a young girl who grows up with an apparently set-in-stone prophecy about how she will spend her final day with a man and have sex with him and that will be the climax and conclusion of her life blah blah blah, but that day arrives and she frankly just finds the whole thing kinda disappointing and unfulfilling and then its over and … life goes on. And when Newt stalls her from opening the new book of Agnes Nutter’s prophecies, something clicks. She begins to hope for the very possibility that has been terrifying her since the world didn’t end. Perhaps … perhaps she needn’t be a descendent with a pre-written story any longer. Perhaps, after all, she isn’t doomed to choose the life previous generations chose for her.

I highly doubt Anathema’s story is intended to reflect the queer experience. But to me, it rings true to the experience of so many queer women raised with traditional heteronormative expectations writ large to the point that we are long unable to imagine an alternative to the only story we are given.

trail.content_raw:

But to me, it rings true to the experience of so many queer women raised with traditional heteronormative expectations writ large to the point that we are long unable to imagine an alternative to the only story we are given.
trail.content:
I just want to say: I’m delighted many Good Omens fans seem to headcanon Anathema as a lesbian.

There’s plenty of room for multiple interpretations here, and I’m certainly not bothered when people don’t read her that way. But there’s something about this story of a young girl who grows up with an apparently set-in-stone prophecy about how she will spend her final day with a man and have sex with him and that will be the climax and conclusion of her life blah blah blah, but that day arrives and she frankly just finds the whole thing kinda disappointing and unfulfilling and then its over and … life goes on. And when Newt stalls her from opening the new book of Agnes Nutter’s prophecies, something clicks. summary: Sorry you're not feeling good! If you could get a good omens tattoo, what would it be?
question: Sorry you're not feeling good! If you could get a good omens tattoo, what would it be?
answer: I really want a GO tattoo! I know a gorgeous piece of art I would like, and I’ve messaged the artist to ask if I can use it, but I haven’t heard back yet. Hopefully soon!

reblog.comment: I really want a GO tattoo! I know a gorgeous piece of art I would like, and I’ve messaged the artist to ask if I can use it, but I haven’t heard back yet. Hopefully soon!

blog.name: irisbleufic
blog.title: (lives between pages)
blog.description: Holistic Writer / INTJ / Chaotic Good / Slytherin / Jewish / QIA-spec in LGBTQIA+ / autistic rabblerouser / still in my 30s / they-pronouns. Emma Goldman stan. Survivor of traumas I only discuss when relevant. Contains black tea, insomnia, poetry, & fic—but mostly just fic. If you're looking for CoT 'Verse and the rest of my Good Omens fic, you can find it here. As of 2013, all of my old LJ-era fanfiction has been uploaded to AO3. I'm the nutter behind @ask-agnes-nutter, so feel free to send asks. I moderate for the largest, most active GO Discord server, The Ritz; if you would like an invite, please DM me. You can pester me; I strongly encourage anons, because I know not everyone finds sending asks easy. If you want to know where to find my published work, email me on irisbleufic@gmail.com or send a DM. If you make art based on my writing, podfic my stories, or do anything you want me to see, tag it #irisbleufic. I won’t tell folks they shouldn't follow, but there's complex content here. I tag thoroughly. You can ko-fi me if you wish.

summary: I don’t know how many of you are signed up for Paul Kidby’s newsletter, but this morning’s contained quite a number of updates...
caption:
I don’t know how many of you are signed up for Paul Kidby’s newsletter, but this morning’s contained quite a number of updates on the illustrations for the limited editions of Good Omens coming out in conjunction with the miniseries release.

The above will be of particular interest to the fandom at large, I’m quite sure…

summary: Valerie, Angela and Tatiana start with a TCA Round-Up that includes Amazon’s Fleabag (0:50) and Good Omens (6:30), DC Universe’s...
caption:
Valerie, Angela and Tatiana start with a TCA Round-Up that includes Amazon’s Fleabag (0:50) and Good Omens (6:30), DC Universe’s Doom Patrol (13:00), a new streaming service called Cleo TV (19:30), and TBS’ Miracle Workers (22:00). Then they move onto the Oscars’ oncoming train wreck and constant back-and-forth (23:40), as well as the Captain Marvel backlash from dudebros (28:00) and first impressions of the Frozen 2 trailer (32:30). Finally, Tatiana gives a quick mini-review of the Spanish film Everybody Knows (35:20) and Angela kicks off kdrama corner with Touch Your Heart (39:50).

You can let us know your thoughts in the comments below, or on our Podomatic page here.
